commit_message:
Move files out of the namespace package

Move the public API out of oslo.db to oslo_db. Retain the ability to
import from the old namespace package for backwards compatibility for
this release cycle.

Blueprint: drop-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ie96b482b9fbcb1d85203ad35bb65c1f43e912a44

commit_message:
Fix default Apache config cleanup on Debian

The configuration file /etc/apache2/conf-available/openstack-dashboard.conf
is not properly cleaned on Debian Operating System.

Change-Id: Idd495fe9ca0adc70eaad2f59a8b3aee212b2e8e5
Source: https://packages.debian.org/wheezy/all/openstack-dashboard-apache/filelist

This change adds implementations for the required driver methods for
Consistency Groups to be supported with the PureISCSIDriver. There is a
nice direct mapping between Consistency Groups and Purity Protection

commit_message:
Add support to PureISCSIDriver for Consistency Groups

This change adds implementations for the required driver methods for
Consistency Groups to be supported with the PureISCSIDriver. There is a
nice direct mapping between Consistency Groups and Purity Protection
Groups which makes the implementation pretty straightforward.

Implements: blueprint pure-iscsi-consistency-group
Change-Id: I8b97947d4788a7a7ba2dfa1d2b07645eafba76ec

commit_message:
Add unit tests for NetApp do_setup methods

We need to ensure that our do_setup methods are properly calling check_flags.
This patch adds tests to that effect.  We also need to ensure that our config
documentation is accurate; this also fixes a minor issue for that.

Change-Id: I99eea59c2451fe1508bafa6ae1ed792b3d0b952e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-11 21:00:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/iscsi/iscsi.py'], 'message': "Brick: fix bug in tgt conf for volume

872b7ca0fc5ce4911fdaadee464d46be5a38058d was intended to explicitly
specify the driver being used by tgt for each target. The issue is that
'lld' is not a valid directive therefore the default is being used. The
default used by tgt is iscsi.

This commit replaces 'lld' with the correct directive of 'driver'.

Change-Id: I6153ee8b24039aedc4ab471f7d00517411791dac
Closes-bug: #1396265
"}]
commit_message:
Brick: fix bug in tgt conf for volume

872b7ca0fc5ce4911fdaadee464d46be5a38058d was intended to explicitly
specify the driver being used by tgt for each target. The issue is that
'lld' is not a valid directive therefore the default is being used. The
default used by tgt is iscsi.

This commit replaces 'lld' with the correct directive of 'driver'.

Change-Id: I6153ee8b24039aedc4ab471f7d00517411791dac
Closes-bug: #1396265

commit_message:
Optimize resource list query

Instead of 2 queries per resource
to fetch min and max sample timestamp
value, replaced with a single query of
similar cost. Another query of lesser
cost to retrieve the resource details.

Change-Id: I50d4a63a387e6a83c6090ebeafe7a330c5fda61c
Closes-Bug: #1404076

subject: Provide a quick way to run flake8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-29 14:16:43.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': "Provide a quick way to run flake8

Patch copied from nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/110746/

'run_tests.sh -p' always checks every file for errors.
This patch adds 'run_tests.sh -8' which only checks the files
that were modified in HEAD commit or the current working tree.

time ./run_tests.sh -p
Running flake8 ...
./glance/async/eventlet_executor.py:29:80: E501 line too
long (82 > 79 characters)

real    0m11.489s
user    0m11.342s
sys     0m0.136s

time ./run_tests.sh -8
Running flake8 on doc/source/configuring.rst
etc/glance-api.conf glance/async/eventlet_executor.py run_tests.sh
./glance/async/eventlet_executor.py:29:80: E501 line too
long (82 > 79 characters)

real    0m0.604s
user    0m0.549s
sys     0m0.059s

Change-Id: I5fa9e85da017da3989a76caf95831f3ac927d1b7
"}]
commit_message:
Provide a quick way to run flake8

Patch copied from nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/110746/

'run_tests.sh -p' always checks every file for errors.
This patch adds 'run_tests.sh -8' which only checks the files
that were modified in HEAD commit or the current working tree.

time ./run_tests.sh -p
Running flake8 ...
./glance/async/eventlet_executor.py:29:80: E501 line too
long (82 > 79 characters)

real    0m11.489s
user    0m11.342s
sys     0m0.136s

time ./run_tests.sh -8
Running flake8 on doc/source/configuring.rst
etc/glance-api.conf glance/async/eventlet_executor.py run_tests.sh
./glance/async/eventlet_executor.py:29:80: E501 line too
long (82 > 79 characters)

real    0m0.604s
user    0m0.549s
sys     0m0.059s

Change-Id: I5fa9e85da017da3989a76caf95831f3ac927d1b7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-22 08:49:18.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore'], 'message': "Update .gitignore file

1) We need to ship metadata.json with puppet modules because of
deprecation of Modulefile:

https://docs.puppetlabs.com/puppet/latest/reference/modules_publishing.html

DEPRECATION WARNING As of Puppet 3.6 the Modulefile has been deprecated
in favor of the metadata.json file.

Some modules already have no Modulefile and it's impossibleto check
such module's source/dependencies since we ignore metadata.json

2) We're going to use 'bundle' in our CI. So in order to run some
CI tests localy in the working dir it would be convenient to ignore
.bundled_gems directory that will be created by CI scripts.

Change-Id: I5523e84480ef3638a5442ac683d5e648d9f8a0fd
"}]
commit_message:
Update .gitignore file

1) We need to ship metadata.json with puppet modules because of
deprecation of Modulefile:

https://docs.puppetlabs.com/puppet/latest/reference/modules_publishing.html

DEPRECATION WARNING As of Puppet 3.6 the Modulefile has been deprecated
in favor of the metadata.json file.

Some modules already have no Modulefile and it's impossibleto check
such module's source/dependencies since we ignore metadata.json

2) We're going to use 'bundle' in our CI. So in order to run some
CI tests localy in the working dir it would be convenient to ignore
.bundled_gems directory that will be created by CI scripts.

Change-Id: I5523e84480ef3638a5442ac683d5e648d9f8a0fd

commit_message:
Use string.ascii_lowercase and string.ascii_uppercase only

"string.lowercase" and "string.uppercase" were removed in Python 3,
we can use only "string.ascii_lowercase" and "string.ascii_uppercase".

Change-Id: I97ddac01af7070129ad8baf5960c841482c346a2
Closes-Bug: #1405918

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-11-20 15:44:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/loadbalancer/agent/agent_manager.py', 'neutron/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/cfg.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/agent/test_agent_manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/test_namespace_driver.py', 'neutron/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/namespace_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/test_cfg.py'], 'message': 'LBaaS: haproxy driver should respect vip/pool admin state

On vip/pool update when admin_state_up becomes False
haproxy driver should reflect it in the config.

Currently there may be only one vip in the config and
if it is disabled, haproxy process fails to restart with
"[ALERT] 084/045122 (11407) : [haproxy.main()] No enabled
listener found (check the <listen> keywords) ! Exiting.",
and continues running and balancing with old config -
so for this case we need to undeploy loadbalancer.

The patch also moves namespace deletion to delete_pool()
as there is no need to delete/recreate namespace each time
the vip is removed/added or disabled/enabled

Closes-Bug: #1155092
Closes-Bug: #1297142
Change-Id: I11e2bd3185328ba47ba1aaede932e3114263bed8
'}]
commit_message:
LBaaS: haproxy driver should respect vip/pool admin state

On vip/pool update when admin_state_up becomes False
haproxy driver should reflect it in the config.

Currently there may be only one vip in the config and
if it is disabled, haproxy process fails to restart with
"[ALERT] 084/045122 (11407) : [haproxy.main()] No enabled
listener found (check the <listen> keywords) ! Exiting.",
and continues running and balancing with old config -
so for this case we need to undeploy loadbalancer.

The patch also moves namespace deletion to delete_pool()
as there is no need to delete/recreate namespace each time
the vip is removed/added or disabled/enabled

Closes-Bug: #1155092
Closes-Bug: #1297142
Change-Id: I11e2bd3185328ba47ba1aaede932e3114263bed8

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-30 08:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['novaproxy/nova/compute/manager_proxy.py'], 'message': "Cache cascaded nova client

We make the python novaclient as a memeber of ComputeManager, each
time used, we create it only if it's None. This avoids creating the
token for every request.
Note that the python-novaclient can re-auth when the token is expired,
so we need not to do it in application level.

Change-Id: I4a5644264383ffdf863759245086f2a6889152bf
"}]
commit_message:
Cache cascaded nova client

We make the python novaclient as a memeber of ComputeManager, each
time used, we create it only if it's None. This avoids creating the
token for every request.
Note that the python-novaclient can re-auth when the token is expired,
so we need not to do it in application level.

Change-Id: I4a5644264383ffdf863759245086f2a6889152bf

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-29 20:37:14.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Preupgrade setuptools in tox tempestenv

* tox.ini: If setuptools is declared as a dependency, even
transitively, it can trigger a race in some versions of pip when
called with -U wherein pip removes setuptools in preparation for
upgrading it, and then proceeds to install something else using
setuptools. Work around this behavior by upgrading setuptools within
the virtualenv in advance.

Change-Id: I6d9bf61c1ce41e46ff6f621bfa88d511f6c16120
Related-Bug: #1405579
'}]
commit_message:
Preupgrade setuptools in tox tempestenv

* tox.ini: If setuptools is declared as a dependency, even
transitively, it can trigger a race in some versions of pip when
called with -U wherein pip removes setuptools in preparation for
upgrading it, and then proceeds to install something else using
setuptools. Work around this behavior by upgrading setuptools within
the virtualenv in advance.

Change-Id: I6d9bf61c1ce41e46ff6f621bfa88d511f6c16120
Related-Bug: #1405579

subject: Potential 500 pages on allowed methods removed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-29 17:54:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/vpn/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/aggregates/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/panel.py'], 'message': 'Potential 500 pages on allowed methods removed

The VPN, Firewall and Loadbalancers panels all have checks to see if the
appropriate service is enabled. This call requires a neutron API call
that is not protected in a try/except block. If there is a problem with
the neutron service, on login, the user encounters the 500 page and is
unable to do anything in Horizon.

The same is true of checking enabled extensions in the Aggregates panel.

The desired experience is the user should still be able to log in and
perform actions unrelated to those misconfigured/down services.

Closes-Bug: #1406329
Change-Id: I8b0eae53c1b8c9a8bc9376e6d813dd6d2bea0e9b
'}]
commit_message:
Potential 500 pages on allowed methods removed

The VPN, Firewall and Loadbalancers panels all have checks to see if the
appropriate service is enabled. This call requires a neutron API call
that is not protected in a try/except block. If there is a problem with
the neutron service, on login, the user encounters the 500 page and is
unable to do anything in Horizon.

The same is true of checking enabled extensions in the Aggregates panel.

The desired experience is the user should still be able to log in and
perform actions unrelated to those misconfigured/down services.

Closes-Bug: #1406329
Change-Id: I8b0eae53c1b8c9a8bc9376e6d813dd6d2bea0e9b

commit_message:
Set type=internal as part of port creation

When creating an internal device with ovs-vsctl, the 'set'
operation must occur as part of the transaction that creates the
port, otherwise the device creation will fail and an ofport will
not be assigned.

Change-Id: I30ecb920ee1c64d25b5e7eed69e92bd71caac435

When you can't access target host during cold migrating,

So, when you are using util.execute(), especially ssh can use
following options.
options :  NumberOfPasswordPrompts=0

And if you want, you can change ssh options using nova.conf

commit_message:
rollback status when cold migrate failed.

When you can't access target host during cold migrating,
VM status doesn't rollback.

Cold migration uses ssh command.
There's a precondition which a target host can be connected
using ssh Host key from a source host without prompt.

So, when you are using util.execute(), especially ssh can use
following options.
options :  NumberOfPasswordPrompts=0
           StrictHostKeyChecking=no
           -p 22

And if you want, you can change ssh options using nova.conf

[libvirt]
ssh_connection_options=-o NumberOfPasswordPrompts=0,
-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no, -p 22

Change-Id: I61f98f781db284cb86bde4eca5a2ac543fec4404
DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1323989

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-25 04:11:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/rpc/handlers/dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py'], 'message': "Use dict comprehensions instead of dict constructor

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions [1], these are benefits:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.

Neutron dropped python 2.6 support in Kilo, we can leaverage this now.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/

Change-Id: I1d8141bb7a5a3ac56ac5bd8609f13043c198d188
"}]
commit_message:
Use dict comprehensions instead of dict constructor

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions [1], these are benefits:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.

Neutron dropped python 2.6 support in Kilo, we can leaverage this now.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/

Change-Id: I1d8141bb7a5a3ac56ac5bd8609f13043c198d188

commit_message:
Allow setting a tenant router's external IP

Adds an external_ip option to the router creation
and update operations to set the IP address the router
will try to use as its fixed IP on the external network
it's attached to. By default this is restricted to an
admin-only operation by policy.json.

DocImpact
ApiImpact

Implements: blueprint specify-router-ext-ip
Closes-Bug: #1188427
Change-Id: Iba7c606eea48181fc10e9d0d5dc667e6f48f37de

commit_message:
Fix log message on exception in setUpClass

This commit fixes an issue with the log messages printed when an
arbitrary exception is raised during setUpClass. Previously the
variables were provided in the wrong order causing the log message
to be confusing.

Change-Id: Ie3682284905f0d31c801aac731ae843fae0fd314

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-22 23:04:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/l3_router/brocade/l3_router_plugin.py'], 'message': 'brocade: Use lazy logging interpolation

There are a small number of examples of "eager" interpolation in
neutron:
  logging.debug("foo %s" % arg)

These should be converted to perform the interpolation lazily within
the logging function, since if the severity is below the logging level
then the interpolation can be skipped entirely.

This change addresses all such examples found in brocade
l3_router_plugin via a pylint test.  Other occurrences are addressed
elsewhere.

Change-Id: Ia2d51e8ecbc7af81390577ec69c5ce18523b65f3
Partial-Bug: #1404788
'}]
commit_message:
brocade: Use lazy logging interpolation

There are a small number of examples of "eager" interpolation in
neutron:
  logging.debug("foo %s" % arg)

These should be converted to perform the interpolation lazily within
the logging function, since if the severity is below the logging level
then the interpolation can be skipped entirely.

This change addresses all such examples found in brocade
l3_router_plugin via a pylint test.  Other occurrences are addressed
elsewhere.

Change-Id: Ia2d51e8ecbc7af81390577ec69c5ce18523b65f3
Partial-Bug: #1404788

commit_message:
linuxbridge: Use lazy logging interpolation

There are a small number of examples of "eager" interpolation in
neutron:
  logging.debug("foo %s" % arg)

These should be converted to perform the interpolation lazily within
the logging function, since if the severity is below the logging level
then the interpolation can be skipped entirely.

This change addresses all such examples found in linuxbridge agent via a
pylint test.  Other occurrences are addressed elsewhere.

Change-Id: I5cb3bbb401f5049760dfe5263a52bd43f23dcfd4
Partial-Bug: #1404788

commit_message:
Xenapi: Allow volume backed instances to migrate

The migrate process had no provisions for a non image backed instance.
This remedies that by doing a few things:

Don't snapshot the root disk on the source host.
Don't try to import the root disk on the destination host.
Connect the volume to the destination host as the boot device.

Change-Id: Ia453cf33a36803b1b5447c6240988a3dd603f328
Closes-bug: #1375480

The main purpose of this spec is to help improve Horizon's user
experience with the volume type extra specs management processes. This
spec proposes that Cinder provides a list of possible volume type extra
specs keys for users to choose from when creating or editing extra
specs. The current process in Horizon provides no useful help in terms
of what the possible extra specs keys and values might be. Users have to
know the exact spellings ahead of time. Having a list of possible keys
for users to choose from will help lessen the time users spend on this
task.

commit_message:
Get supported volume type extra specs keys

The main purpose of this spec is to help improve Horizon's user
experience with the volume type extra specs management processes. This
spec proposes that Cinder provides a list of possible volume type extra
specs keys for users to choose from when creating or editing extra
specs. The current process in Horizon provides no useful help in terms
of what the possible extra specs keys and values might be. Users have to
know the exact spellings ahead of time. Having a list of possible keys
for users to choose from will help lessen the time users spend on this
task.

DocImpact
blueprint: get-volume-type-extra-specs
Change-Id: I0aa874bff02a5e86eb8237260aafaeffd7408afd

commit_message:
Pass along admin_port for users endpoint

When dealing with the users end point, the configured admin_port should
be passed along, otherwise the endpoint object will default to the 35357
admin port, and connection will fail.

Change-Id: I4af2416bc6511fe849a045591e2b011b19bdb2a0

commit_message:
Hyper-V: cleanup basevolumeutils

This patch implements a TODO that was there for some time now,
using Regex in order to retrieve the disk number from a physical
drive path.

Also, some WQL queries have been replaced with filters, which
are cleaner and safer.

Change-Id: I6ee54b72b142cffc271b271937f1b3f9b6b6dbdf

commit_message:
Make region sticky on Login page

The region from last login is used as the default selected
region when the Login page loads.

commit_message:
Creates a new Plugin Development Guide

Since Fuel 6.0 supports Pluggable architecture,
a separate Guide is created to describe the following:

* how to install a plugin
* example plugins
* how to create a plugin
* how plugin UI elements should look like

Links to plug-in-related CRs:

* Certification issue (to be posted to Plug-in DevGuide): https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140421/

* User Guide instructions for installing plug-ins: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130506/

* Update Terminology articles https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140350/

Change-Id: I78668b7bdc0e1b4f09244146a789bb12c921100c
Closes-Bug: 1397889

Since Fuel 6.0 has a brand new feature,

* Certification issue (to be posted to Plug-in DevGuide): https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140421/

* Updates on Terminology articles: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140350/

subject: Add test coverage for `splice` and `tee` failure scenarios
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-22 10:30:48.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py'], 'message': "Add test coverage for `splice` and `tee` failure scenarios

This patch adds 2 new tests for `swift.obj.diskfile.zero_copy_send`,
injecting a failure scenario when `tee` doesn't copy all bytes in one
go as it's expected to by the code, and one which tests whether the
code correctly trampolines when `splice` returns `EWOULDBLOCK`.

This was suggested by Paul Luse in review 135319 (for 2a0a8ae00f2), and
now covers code paths which were previously untested.

Change-Id: Ife84d772320d6214c93d8044feb613389f71e8da
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/135319/4/swift/common/splice.py,cm
See: 2a0a8ae00f2d3b7db255b0905b063e930f824f3d
"}]
commit_message:
Add test coverage for `splice` and `tee` failure scenarios

This patch adds 2 new tests for `swift.obj.diskfile.zero_copy_send`,
injecting a failure scenario when `tee` doesn't copy all bytes in one
go as it's expected to by the code, and one which tests whether the
code correctly trampolines when `splice` returns `EWOULDBLOCK`.

This was suggested by Paul Luse in review 135319 (for 2a0a8ae00f2), and
now covers code paths which were previously untested.

Change-Id: Ife84d772320d6214c93d8044feb613389f71e8da
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/135319/4/swift/common/splice.py,cm
See: 2a0a8ae00f2d3b7db255b0905b063e930f824f3d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-24 19:29:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp_eseries_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp_nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp.py'], 'message': "Mock calls to rpm and dpkg from NetApp unit tests

This patch fixes an issue wherein several NetApp unit tests ran
OS rpm or dpkg commands because the callouts to these commands
were not mocked out during driver initialization.

It also replaces 'rpm -qa' with 'rpm -q' when that command is
invoked since the latter also works and is faster.

Closes-Bug: 1393545
Change-Id: I3d5cfeb2ee39ecb6af5b312dfa6c2a585cf8e0e3
(cherry picked from commit d555ca100aeb176bc021b8179d2a5cdfe10e168e)
"}]
commit_message:
Mock calls to rpm and dpkg from NetApp unit tests

This patch fixes an issue wherein several NetApp unit tests ran
OS rpm or dpkg commands because the callouts to these commands
were not mocked out during driver initialization.

It also replaces 'rpm -qa' with 'rpm -q' when that command is
invoked since the latter also works and is faster.

Closes-Bug: 1393545
Change-Id: I3d5cfeb2ee39ecb6af5b312dfa6c2a585cf8e0e3
(cherry picked from commit d555ca100aeb176bc021b8179d2a5cdfe10e168e)

commit_message:
VMware: fix security group check on port create

The code did not consider an empty list among the cases
in which security groups are not supplied on port create.

Change-Id: I325cce2165d2ec683ecac3cabdbfb80a03b288c9
Closes-Bug: #1405311

- share http request object among tests

commit_message:
Merge 6.0 docs from master to stable/6.0 branch

All commits squashed into one due to gerrit refusing some commits in the
cherry-picked series and to simplify the final merge.

This commit brings stable/6.0 in sync with the master branch commit
6309b56bf05742db34a50536bc66e376f432fa23.

Change-Id: Id47cb5f6e6dc3264328ee473b416a848e6b96eec

subject: Retry Rackspace LB nodes operations if immutable
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-23 18:44:07.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_cloud_loadbalancer.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/cloud_loadbalancer.py'], 'message': 'Retry Rackspace LB nodes operations if immutable

During certain operations, Rackspace::Cloud::LoadBalancer may reach
immutable states.  If an operation happens at such times, the entire
stack update will fail.  This patch adds retry logic to wait until LB
leaves the immutable state before proceeding.

Closes-Bug: #1401333
Change-Id: I46692f29b57a8c5db9a2dfab11ac5dc9ad631d45
'}]
commit_message:
Retry Rackspace LB nodes operations if immutable

During certain operations, Rackspace::Cloud::LoadBalancer may reach
immutable states.  If an operation happens at such times, the entire
stack update will fail.  This patch adds retry logic to wait until LB
leaves the immutable state before proceeding.

Closes-Bug: #1401333
Change-Id: I46692f29b57a8c5db9a2dfab11ac5dc9ad631d45

commit_message:
Add service_name parameter to neuron::server class

Allow for customizing the name of the neutron-server service.
The use case here is for organizations that build their own
OpenStack packages, and the service names may differ slightly
from the upstream distro defaults.

Change-Id: If539c51279a8a675e40e356fb4445b6324b75936

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-27 22:10:25.000000000', 'files': ['tools/install_pip.sh'], 'message': "Call sudo /w -H in install_pip.sh as well

We updated other usage of sudo to pass -H when installing pip things,
to avoid creating a .cache directory in $STACK_USER's $HOME that is
owned by root. get-pip.py also ends up creating a ~/.cache, so we
need to update sudo usage there as well.

Closes-bug: #1405626
Related-bug: #1405732

Change-Id: If791b9b25d6a4280dab19117004184e57e78d038
"}]
commit_message:
Call sudo /w -H in install_pip.sh as well

We updated other usage of sudo to pass -H when installing pip things,
to avoid creating a .cache directory in $STACK_USER's $HOME that is
owned by root. get-pip.py also ends up creating a ~/.cache, so we
need to update sudo usage there as well.

Closes-bug: #1405626
Related-bug: #1405732

Change-Id: If791b9b25d6a4280dab19117004184e57e78d038

commit_message:
Allow to specify IP address of floating ip

IP address of floating ip will be automatically allocated.
There are cases where users need to specify a floating IP address.
This patch addresses the problem.

The feature is limited by "create_floatingip:floating_ip_address" in
"policy.json".
By default, it needs an admin role.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Implements: blueprint allow-specific-floating-ip-address

Change-Id: Iba64a0f0a38ca5eb39c605e121a12c956637b96c

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-12-23 03:54:00.000000000', 'files': ['.pylintrc', 'neutron/extensions/loadbalancerv2.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_link_support.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/apic/apic_topology.py', 'neutron/plugins/midonet/midonet_lib.py', 'neutron/policy.py', 'neutron/extensions/loadbalancer.py', 'neutron/plugins/bigswitch/db/consistency_db.py', 'neutron/plugins/sriovnicagent/eswitch_manager.py'], 'message': 'Enable pylint checks for "anomalous" string escapes

Escapes in python string literals are well defined, but can be
confusing.  These pylint checks look for backslash escapes in strings
that might be mistakes.  Two code refactors were required to satisfy
these tests:

1. midonet_lib.py used \**kwargs in docstrings.

There doesn't seem to be a sphinx standard for kwargs, so this change
simply replaces them with "kwargs".

2. Regex literals containing escapes replaced with r''.

The assumption with this change (and the underlying pylint
check) is that r'' literals are more straightforward for regular
expressions, where every backslash is important.

While looking at these regexes, this change also removes a few
unnecessary "\-" escapes.

Change-Id: I01528b2482f78b9e851685ebbf6fded4e58355f1
'}]
commit_message:
Enable pylint checks for "anomalous" string escapes

Escapes in python string literals are well defined, but can be
confusing.  These pylint checks look for backslash escapes in strings
that might be mistakes.  Two code refactors were required to satisfy
these tests:

1. midonet_lib.py used \**kwargs in docstrings.

There doesn't seem to be a sphinx standard for kwargs, so this change
simply replaces them with "kwargs".

2. Regex literals containing escapes replaced with r''.

The assumption with this change (and the underlying pylint
check) is that r'' literals are more straightforward for regular
expressions, where every backslash is important.

While looking at these regexes, this change also removes a few
unnecessary "\-" escapes.

Change-Id: I01528b2482f78b9e851685ebbf6fded4e58355f1

commit_message:
Add Rally performace job template for Mistral

Mistral team would like to use Rally for testing.
We have to create a separated Rally job template because Mistral
is not installed by default in DSVM jobs.

Change-Id: I05afc391d52763cde9381db2fb2ad76246ea3d11

commit_message:
Graph based task serializer for deployment

Historically dependencies between roles was hardcoded in nailgun
orchestration logic. To support granular roles and plugins
we need to be able to define it with configuration.

The easiest and most essential way to resolve dependencies
between roles, tasks and stages is to use graph model, which is
added in this patch.

RFC of API:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/rfc_granular_api

Required change in astute:
  Change-Id: I28928e86ea4017288478703c6075b315b120349a

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks
Change-Id: Ie627cbe54cd88627ece3d5b559daf0475f460abb

Add ComputeClient for cleanup

In compute clients, there is a lot of duplicated code for setting
CONF. This patch adds ComputeClient for removing them.

Change-Id: I47908c426177be301bb9b963224c6a6afbb24ed1

There are two telemetry clients as a base one and a JSON one. This
implementation way is different from the other projects' clients.

commit_message:
Merge telemetry clients to a single class

There are two telemetry clients as a base one and a JSON one. This
implementation way is different from the other projects' clients.
Now we need to implement a rest client method as a library function,
and it is necessary to make the rest implementations consistent now.
Then, this patch merges telemetry clients to a single class like the
other projects' ones.

Change-Id: Ifbe058df9c4e269a359a65f31efd1d34f208d253

commit_message:
Granular deployment

Async puppet deployment task support.
Use puppet nailgun hooks as main deployment
mechanism for new(6.1) and old(<6.1) clusters.

TODO:
- more tests for puppet tasks;
- refactoring.

Implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I28928e86ea4017288478703c6075b315b120349a

commit_message:
Don't hardcode strict Fabric version

We need this patch as intermediate step in order to:

* do not break building fuel master iso
* to get new fabric in our mirrors

Related change to fuel-main: I6755b6280f60b86affc8b051ab68bb52204f8810
Related-Bug: #1358265

Change-Id: Icab1b20fbabc49885a49fc9cdf17d6883fcdde28

commit_message:
Add possibility to run update only

Start from 5.1 we can run update without upgrade
So in this patch:
Run upgrade script with variable UPGRADE=openstack
Update packages version for 5.1.1

Change-Id: I6e2fd1dabefca593181b787febe1be140caeedc8
Closes-Bug: #1395033

commit_message:
Add additional net verification

In case if we split  fixed network for smalest ones,
test that verify cidr with nova is the same
as nailgun has failed
So add additional check that verifies that each
splited sunbet in in defined in nailgun network

Fix some flake8 warnings

Change-Id: I6229cf694ea204a378eb1278c29ebe8faa9e2d69

commit_message:
Add a temporary fix for OSTF for vCenter tests

In the implementation of our features, OSTF test cannot be
completed successfully. For this reason, we obtained a negative
result in our Jenkin's tests. This patch disables the alert about this
issue. A proper fix for OSTF will be provided a little later.

Change-Id: I642ddd026e9ab65e53988b4af975e3dffa35e772
Related-bug: #1405493

commit_message:
Fix regex for checking private data in statistics

Change regexp for matching data types which can contain
some network information (e.g. public IP network address).
Currently it also matches allowed types of info - used
for deployments 'predefined_networks', 'network_type',
'network_scheme'.

Change-Id: I987ca924f3336b5956707624e00dd1d0238e5d6f
Implements: blueprint fuel-stats-test

commit_message:
Add var to tests which enables stats checking

Add an additional variable FUEL_STATS_CHECK to
system tests settings which enables checking of
gathered usage statistics after performing tests
(currently only few tests support that). Existing
var FUEL_STATS_ENABLED is used for enabling stats
collecting in Nailgun settings.

Change-Id: I4250fd455b7149b2ef227e79b44170aef07f29ae
Implements: blueprint fuel-stats-test

subject: Check stats collecting after tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6719, 'name': 'tatyana-leontovich', 'email': 'tleontovich@mirantis.com', 'username': 'tatyana-leontovich'}, {'_account_id': 8882, 'name': 'Nastya Urlapova', 'email': 'aurlapova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NastyaUrlapova'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10136, 'name': 'Andrey Sledzinskiy', 'email': 'asledzinskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asledzinskiy'}, {'_account_id': 11969, 'name': 'Dennis Dmitriev', 'email': 'dis.xcom@gmail.com', 'username': 'ddmitriev'}, {'_account_id': 12867, 'name': 'Dmitry Tyzhnenko', 'email': 't.dmitry@gmail.com', 'username': 't.dmitry'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-24 20:27:41.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/helpers/decorators.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/environment.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_multiple_networks.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_environment_action.py', 'fuelweb_test/helpers/checkers.py'], 'message': "Check stats collecting after tests

Check that usage stats are sent (if sending enabled)
or not sent (if sending disabled) after the following
tests:

 - deploy_flat_stop_reset_on_deploying
 - deploy_reset_on_ready
 - multiple_cluster_net_neutron_gre_ha

In system tests we can use one environment (with the
same master node uuid) in several different tests,
so the count of sent to collector logs can be greater
than we expect in particular test.

Also, improve 'get_ssh_to_remote_by_key' method,
so it can get SSH keys from SSH-Agent (usefull
on Jenkins) and fail test if Fuel master node is
unavailable via SSH after resuming environment.

Change-Id: I90d3c6f77f303629e2eeaf6d12b82da0f2510140
Implements: blueprint fuel-stats-test
"}]
commit_message:
Check stats collecting after tests

Check that usage stats are sent (if sending enabled)
or not sent (if sending disabled) after the following
tests:

 - deploy_flat_stop_reset_on_deploying
 - deploy_reset_on_ready
 - multiple_cluster_net_neutron_gre_ha

In system tests we can use one environment (with the
same master node uuid) in several different tests,
so the count of sent to collector logs can be greater
than we expect in particular test.

Also, improve 'get_ssh_to_remote_by_key' method,
so it can get SSH keys from SSH-Agent (usefull
on Jenkins) and fail test if Fuel master node is
unavailable via SSH after resuming environment.

Change-Id: I90d3c6f77f303629e2eeaf6d12b82da0f2510140
Implements: blueprint fuel-stats-test

commit_message:
Add decorator to check Fuel statistics sending

Add new decorator which can parse test docstring to
determine what actions were performed during the test and
then check that they were logged and sent to statistics
collector service properly.
It expects that collector host permit login via SSH using
RSA key located in user's home directory.
If sending of usage stats isn't enabled in tests, decorator
will check that statistics wasn't sent.
Also verify the absence of private info (e.g. passwords,
IPs, nodes names) in collected data.

Change-Id: Ia79ca9deef436357bcec19e78611c3b228874e63
Implements: blueprint fuel-stats-test
(cherry picked from commit e20ff6ddc4748d2a32511c472d3bcf510925f7df)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-25 15:45:25.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/network.pp'], 'message': 'Increase lease time for dhcp agent

Usually failover takes a couple of minutes. 120 seconds is not enough so
during failover VMs loose IP address, breaking the connectivity.
Increasing the value to 600 allows

* Minimaze the number of DHCPDISCOVER requests during failover
* Minimaze the load on dnsmasq as it will be less frequently renewing IP
  addresses for VMs

Change-Id: I7dc57e3f79ed8ee5e83c26e0c80d6a44e0840b4a
Closes-Bug: 1371104
'}]
commit_message:
Increase lease time for dhcp agent

Usually failover takes a couple of minutes. 120 seconds is not enough so
during failover VMs loose IP address, breaking the connectivity.
Increasing the value to 600 allows

* Minimaze the number of DHCPDISCOVER requests during failover
* Minimaze the load on dnsmasq as it will be less frequently renewing IP
  addresses for VMs

Change-Id: I7dc57e3f79ed8ee5e83c26e0c80d6a44e0840b4a
Closes-Bug: 1371104

commit_message:
Fix is_public munge

Commit 031609b57284cf13877ce727c2e4672831a3dbe2 changed the way
is_public was munged. However, when testing it it looks like it
was always seen as an empty string after this, so all created
images were private. Changing the way the 'if' block is done fixes
it.

Change-Id: If2eb52a6d0d9be89c9323702616f62f8ecba5e02

commit_message:
Fixes HEAD return code for OS-INHERIT extension

According to the API spec, the return for inherited role assignments
checks is "204 No Content", which is not accurate since it returns
"200 OK".

Change-Id: I8a09a557b3495c995103a52e3f4dce4da747871a
Closes-Bug: 1397318

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-12-27 07:36:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py'], 'message': "Don't unnecessarily loop through all ports/interfaces

The ovs-vsctl 'list' command can take a list of records as an
argument, so there is no need to manually loop through all records
discarding the ones with names that don't match the bridge's
port name list.

Also, since the data is returned as json, the ofport returned isn't
a string, so we don't have to convert it to int for testing.

Closes-Bug: #1404935
Change-Id: Ica20f8f8315196aa5a04657d28dde41a75f0368d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't unnecessarily loop through all ports/interfaces

The ovs-vsctl 'list' command can take a list of records as an
argument, so there is no need to manually loop through all records
discarding the ones with names that don't match the bridge's
port name list.

Also, since the data is returned as json, the ofport returned isn't
a string, so we don't have to convert it to int for testing.

Closes-Bug: #1404935
Change-Id: Ica20f8f8315196aa5a04657d28dde41a75f0368d

commit_message:
RBD: use image_conversion_dir for image operations

This patch deprecates the rbd-only 'volume_tmp_dir' from the rbd driver
in favor of image_conversion_dir for image operations.

Closes-Bug: #1375490
DocImpact: config option removal
Change-Id: I46ab21c2a90be136d1eb677fcefcc3d65c48a3c5

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-22 23:04:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/embrane/agent/dispatcher.py'], 'message': 'embrane: Use lazy logging interpolation

There are a small number of examples of "eager" interpolation in
neutron:
  logging.debug("foo %s" % arg)

These should be converted to perform the interpolation lazily within
the logging function, since if the severity is below the logging level
then the interpolation can be skipped entirely.

This change addresses all such examples found in embrane via a pylint
test.  Other occurrences are addressed elsewhere.

Change-Id: Iabceb8c7d32111ae97d1200fbd25681e317f7bb7
Partial-Bug: #1404788
'}]
commit_message:
embrane: Use lazy logging interpolation

There are a small number of examples of "eager" interpolation in
neutron:
  logging.debug("foo %s" % arg)

These should be converted to perform the interpolation lazily within
the logging function, since if the severity is below the logging level
then the interpolation can be skipped entirely.

This change addresses all such examples found in embrane via a pylint
test.  Other occurrences are addressed elsewhere.

Change-Id: Iabceb8c7d32111ae97d1200fbd25681e317f7bb7
Partial-Bug: #1404788

commit_message:
Remove instance_mapping_uuid_patch

Because of the change in mapping relationship between cascading and
cascaded, the instance_mapping_uuid_patch  is no need exists.

Change-Id: I72606bb8f1d7238a53e0e5caae0671fa4ed105fa

commit_message:
Support flavor sync with accesses info

When launching, reboot or resize a instance, if the flavor's accesses
is changed in cascading, then the modification will be synced to the
cascaded.

Change-Id: I54f0496c9841417966537faeee071ac309b8042d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-22 23:04:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/bigswitch/db/consistency_db.py'], 'message': 'bigswitch: Use lazy logging interpolation

There are a small number of examples of "eager" interpolation in
neutron:
  logging.debug("foo %s" % arg)

These should be converted to perform the interpolation lazily within
the logging function, since if the severity is below the logging level
then the interpolation can be skipped entirely.

This change addresses all such examples found in bigswitch via a pylint
test.  Other occurrences are addressed elsewhere.

Change-Id: I23fd4e7d0e4173e753a124d62a1563ce6ac674ca
Partial-Bug: #1404788
'}]
commit_message:
bigswitch: Use lazy logging interpolation

There are a small number of examples of "eager" interpolation in
neutron:
  logging.debug("foo %s" % arg)

These should be converted to perform the interpolation lazily within
the logging function, since if the severity is below the logging level
then the interpolation can be skipped entirely.

This change addresses all such examples found in bigswitch via a pylint
test.  Other occurrences are addressed elsewhere.

Change-Id: I23fd4e7d0e4173e753a124d62a1563ce6ac674ca
Partial-Bug: #1404788

oslo.concurrency-0.3.0 has moved its path to oslo_concurrency,
the old path oslo.concurrency can still work but is deprecated now.

Closes-Bug: #1398656

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-23 03:54:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Tighten dnsmasq version regex

The previous regex forgot to escape the '.', resulting a more liberal
match than intended.  Luckily it continued to work, since the dnsmasq
version is the first number that appears in the --version output.

This change improves the regex to correctly escape the '.' (as
presumably originally intended) and to look for the prefix "version ".

Change-Id: I12548a7b2c21262aa54c84be4e31bda15eab8d52
'}]
commit_message:
Tighten dnsmasq version regex

The previous regex forgot to escape the '.', resulting a more liberal
match than intended.  Luckily it continued to work, since the dnsmasq
version is the first number that appears in the --version output.

This change improves the regex to correctly escape the '.' (as
presumably originally intended) and to look for the prefix "version ".

Change-Id: I12548a7b2c21262aa54c84be4e31bda15eab8d52

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-23 23:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/redstack'], 'message': "Use 'sudo -H' when installing pip things

New versions of pip creates and uses $HOME/.cache.  diskimage-builder also
uses this path, but it now gets created by root when using pip, causing
later image builds to fail on permissions issues.  This updates sudo usage
during pip installations to pass -H, ensuring pip uses /root/.cache instead
of the stack user.

Similar fixes were requried to devstack, see review #143501.

Change-Id: I8c3c460e9dac1ed1463df37de5810d4faf8512ad
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'sudo -H' when installing pip things

New versions of pip creates and uses $HOME/.cache.  diskimage-builder also
uses this path, but it now gets created by root when using pip, causing
later image builds to fail on permissions issues.  This updates sudo usage
during pip installations to pass -H, ensuring pip uses /root/.cache instead
of the stack user.

Similar fixes were requried to devstack, see review #143501.

Change-Id: I8c3c460e9dac1ed1463df37de5810d4faf8512ad

Several regexes in this class used had unnecessary (\s+) grouping.  This
change makes the regexes slightly cheaper by removing the need for the
regex engine to remember the whitespace that was matched.

Change-Id: I9381c213efe093dc472b0c7e9d7b303a0c7cb13b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary regex grouping

Several regexes in this class used had unnecessary (\s+) grouping.  This
change makes the regexes slightly cheaper by removing the need for the
regex engine to remember the whitespace that was matched.

Change-Id: I9381c213efe093dc472b0c7e9d7b303a0c7cb13b

commit_message:
Expand the description of extra_capabilities

The existing description of extra_capabilities was a bit terse,
meaning deployers couldn't easily gauge the power of this option.
This patch expands the textual description using information from
the blueprint and original commit message, so it can be picked
up automatically by the documentation.

Change-Id: Iac2b6d8a3ce4875a8c1d9874dd7f0e4cf7c435c0
Closes-Bug: 1288044

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-12-21 13:28:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/api/v2/volumes.py', 'cinder/api/v1/volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py'], 'message': 'Fix issue with passing lists in filters

The Cinder db code already allows searching for a value in a list,
for example, id in ['id1', 'id2', 'id3']. The problem is when we
get the value at the API it comes as a string (e.g.
"['id1', 'id2', 'id3']", and therefore the filter fails. This was
already fixed for metadata filters, so just apply it to all filters.

We do a try/except because if it really is a string, then the
literal_eval will fail because we don't pass double quotes, such as
"'string'".  The current code therefore will now cover lists and
fall back to the original behavior for strings.

Change-Id: Idfd8298401a330bb99ddcd130268fabb6ef9d162
Closes-Bug: 1403875
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with passing lists in filters

The Cinder db code already allows searching for a value in a list,
for example, id in ['id1', 'id2', 'id3']. The problem is when we
get the value at the API it comes as a string (e.g.
"['id1', 'id2', 'id3']", and therefore the filter fails. This was
already fixed for metadata filters, so just apply it to all filters.

We do a try/except because if it really is a string, then the
literal_eval will fail because we don't pass double quotes, such as
"'string'".  The current code therefore will now cover lists and
fall back to the original behavior for strings.

Change-Id: Idfd8298401a330bb99ddcd130268fabb6ef9d162
Closes-Bug: 1403875

author_tag_re and log_translation_hints were lists of regexes, where
each member was then separately matched against each input line.

This change combines each of these lists into an a|b regex and removes
the unnecessary loop.

Change-Id: I8db76862d3f7ef030e31e2e1e6f2fcd8dbd00888
'}]
commit_message:
Combine author_tag and log_translation_hint regexes

author_tag_re and log_translation_hints were lists of regexes, where
each member was then separately matched against each input line.

This change combines each of these lists into an a|b regex and removes
the unnecessary loop.

Change-Id: I8db76862d3f7ef030e31e2e1e6f2fcd8dbd00888

commit_message:
Correct use of noqa

Use of "flake8: noqa" disabled hacking checks for the entire file.
Files should use "noqa" instead because that disables hacking checks
only for the line.

This fixes an inappropriate use of "flake8: noqa" and the hacking
issues that were masked.

Change-Id: I7c5b0b9dc4aab7e2129c0886afda0d07dba09afe

Closes-Bug: #1403447

commit_message:
Use six.moves.range instead of xrange

In Python 3, module "xrange" doesn't exist any more.
To support both Python 2 and Python 3, "six.moves.range"
should be used instead.

Change-Id: I9dcf79011a4b2672e4ba55298aa22cab5e2292ff
Closes-Bug: #1403447

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-22 15:57:06.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Declare queue in publisher also

If rabbit dies, the consumer can be disconnected before the publisher
sends, and if the consumer hasn't declared the queue, the publisher's
will send a message to an exchange that's not bound to a queue, and
the message will be lost. So let's create queue on both sides to
prevent loosing messages.

Change-Id: If89065f947051e6001eace9a4d7a9b32c3e096c0
Closes-Bug: 1338732
"}]
commit_message:
Declare queue in publisher also

If rabbit dies, the consumer can be disconnected before the publisher
sends, and if the consumer hasn't declared the queue, the publisher's
will send a message to an exchange that's not bound to a queue, and
the message will be lost. So let's create queue on both sides to
prevent loosing messages.

Change-Id: If89065f947051e6001eace9a4d7a9b32c3e096c0
Closes-Bug: 1338732

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-08-21 12:45:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/identity/__init__.py', 'neutron/services/identity/identity_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/common/constants.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "[1/5] Clean up Neutron resources upon tenant deletion

Currently the different OpenStack components don't delete
resources when tenants are deleted. For large, long-running
deployments this might become a severe issue.

*1/5 - Create the identity service plugin.

 2/5 - Delete tenants by calling out to the core
       and service plugins, deleting all resources in the right
       order. Resources are deleted breadth first if multiple
       tenants are to be deleted. Instead of deleting
       tenant by tenant, delete all ports by all tenants, and
       so on for every type of resource.

 3/5 - Discover tenants that have resources in Neutron, that
       don't exist in Keystone.

 4/5 - Introduce a command line utility that executes code from
       patches 2 & 3. The utility calls out to the discovery
       functionality in the identity service plugin and persists
       the list of tenants to be deleted to disk. It can also
       pass that list to the delete function.

 5/5 - Respond to Keystone RPC notifications about tenant deletion.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #967832
Implements: blueprint tenant-delete

Change-Id: I772137ba48e141004846ed540bfa0b6add5e8f94
"}]
commit_message:
[1/5] Clean up Neutron resources upon tenant deletion

Currently the different OpenStack components don't delete
resources when tenants are deleted. For large, long-running
deployments this might become a severe issue.

*1/5 - Create the identity service plugin.

 2/5 - Delete tenants by calling out to the core
       and service plugins, deleting all resources in the right
       order. Resources are deleted breadth first if multiple
       tenants are to be deleted. Instead of deleting
       tenant by tenant, delete all ports by all tenants, and
       so on for every type of resource.

 3/5 - Discover tenants that have resources in Neutron, that
       don't exist in Keystone.

 4/5 - Introduce a command line utility that executes code from
       patches 2 & 3. The utility calls out to the discovery
       functionality in the identity service plugin and persists
       the list of tenants to be deleted to disk. It can also
       pass that list to the delete function.

 5/5 - Respond to Keystone RPC notifications about tenant deletion.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #967832
Implements: blueprint tenant-delete

Change-Id: I772137ba48e141004846ed540bfa0b6add5e8f94

subject: Use a shared pipe + select (WIP)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-12-23 21:13:15.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/executor.py'], 'message': 'Use a shared pipe + select (WIP)

Instead of using a per-task queue and polling it just
use a shared read/write shared pipe/connections and
use select on those connections to avoid repeated queue
polling to achieve better scalability when using process
based workers.

This also avoids the need to use the multiprocessing
manager proxy and the process it creates for the simple use
case of proxying messages from one process to its parent.

Change-Id: I9facd61923181bf54680a69fcfd8f6ffb45b98ea
'}]
commit_message:
Use a shared pipe + select (WIP)

Instead of using a per-task queue and polling it just
use a shared read/write shared pipe/connections and
use select on those connections to avoid repeated queue
polling to achieve better scalability when using process
based workers.

This also avoids the need to use the multiprocessing
manager proxy and the process it creates for the simple use
case of proxying messages from one process to its parent.

Change-Id: I9facd61923181bf54680a69fcfd8f6ffb45b98ea

commit_message:
Make solum buildable into docker container

this will allow us to hook up our repo to the docker trusted
builds system.   or a user could run
`docker build solum github.com/stackforge/solum`

Dockerfile must be in root of repo to add the whole of solum
to the docker context.

Change-Id: I371d8fed05e2adf15efc810416f90ad9d4edfc7e

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-25 10:24:10.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/networking/section_networking-options-reference.xml'], 'message': 'Use RPC instead of neutron client in metadata agent

Previously, neutron metadata agent connected to a neutron server via REST 
API using a neutron client. This is ineffective because keystone is then 
fully involved into the authentication process and gets overloaded. The 
neutron metadata agent has been reworked to use RPC by default to connect 
to a server since Kilo release.

Closes-Bug: #1386979
'}]
commit_message:
Use RPC instead of neutron client in metadata agent

Previously, neutron metadata agent connected to a neutron server via REST 
API using a neutron client. This is ineffective because keystone is then 
fully involved into the authentication process and gets overloaded. The 
neutron metadata agent has been reworked to use RPC by default to connect 
to a server since Kilo release.

Change-Id: Idaf9fbdb33ad3d5f68f40eef54344bffd842f0a0
Closes-Bug: #1386979

commit_message:
Update glance-api sample

as noted in the bug report, notifier_strategy was removed.
The change was picked up by the auto config tools, but the
 remaining place this was used in manuals was the glance-api
install guide samples. This patch updates the samples from
the glance master, and makes the small number of changes
(flavor, keystone_authtoken setup) that were in the previous
samples.

Change-Id: I673590ed2470d07cce93ed5713c7bffe7f57730c
Closes-Bug: 1332301

commit_message:
Set HTTP PUT Content-Length for container actions

We are not passing any body for the container actions, so let's
default the content length to 0. Otherwise the pecan/wsgi waits
for a body and just hangs.

Change-Id: I9517f611d5a60791c6a03f37deeaab43d96bcc94

Keystone switched over oslotest, oslotest leverages testtools,
and testtools uses standard library unittest[1]. We have moved to
Python 2.7+, so don't write ourself version of assert* methods.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase

Change-Id: I49e178a30b6a5770fe10ac67df28560bb3e5fbbb
"}]
commit_message:
Use standard library unittest's assert* methods

Keystone switched over oslotest, oslotest leverages testtools,
and testtools uses standard library unittest[1]. We have moved to
Python 2.7+, so don't write ourself version of assert* methods.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase

Change-Id: I49e178a30b6a5770fe10ac67df28560bb3e5fbbb

Commit abc16ebf made the get_sg_ids_grouped_by_port function not return
entries for ports without security groups. This causes the agent to not remove
previously created security groups for that port since the port is not
returned in the security_group_info_for_devices data.

commit_message:
return the dict of port when no sec-group involved

Commit abc16ebf made the get_sg_ids_grouped_by_port function not return
entries for ports without security groups. This causes the agent to not remove
previously created security groups for that port since the port is not
returned in the security_group_info_for_devices data.

This change fixes that by always including a list of security groups for each
port, even if that list is empty.

Change-Id: I9616708462a8b6f3d46ebd76db5cf8cb2826f4ad
Closes-Bug: #1398312
(cherry picked from commit 997e70751c74004983b1e4079b084431ed0c7d27)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-25 00:47:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Delete FIP namespace when last VM is deleted

On a compute node when the last VM with a floating IP association
is deleted, the L3 agent did not delete the fip namespace. However
the api server has already deleted the fip agent external gateway
port from the database.

This problem is happening on DVRs because the deletion of a VM port,
in addition to a floating IP disassociation, may also result in the
removal of the external gateway port binding AND the removal of the
fip agent external gateway port.

When the L3 agent is handling a routers_updated notification, it is
not processing floating ip address updates when the router has both
a floating ip disassociated and a external gateway port deleted.
This patch corrects this problem.

cherry-picked from e3b949c3bc08808e3df15215bc30d6610f3a4bd3
Closes-bug: #1377156
Change-Id: I86bdef7c9d988cb9d87c88adde55548d459f29a5
'}]
commit_message:
Delete FIP namespace when last VM is deleted

On a compute node when the last VM with a floating IP association
is deleted, the L3 agent did not delete the fip namespace. However
the api server has already deleted the fip agent external gateway
port from the database.

This problem is happening on DVRs because the deletion of a VM port,
in addition to a floating IP disassociation, may also result in the
removal of the external gateway port binding AND the removal of the
fip agent external gateway port.

When the L3 agent is handling a routers_updated notification, it is
not processing floating ip address updates when the router has both
a floating ip disassociated and a external gateway port deleted.
This patch corrects this problem.

cherry-picked from e3b949c3bc08808e3df15215bc30d6610f3a4bd3
Closes-bug: #1377156
Change-Id: I86bdef7c9d988cb9d87c88adde55548d459f29a5

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-25 00:46:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Fix race condition on processing DVR floating IPs

Fip namespace and agent gateway port can be shared by multiple dvr routers.
This change uses a set as the control variable for these shared resources
and ensures that Test and Set operation on the control variable are
performed atomically so that race conditions do not occur among
multiple threads processing floating IPs.
Limitation: The scope of this change is limited to addressing the race
condition described in the bug report. It may not address other issues
such as pre-existing issue with handling of DVR floatingips on agent
restart.

closes-bug: #1381238

cherry-picked from 9902400039018d77aa3034147cfb24ca4b2353f6
Change-Id: I6dc2b7bad6e8ddbaa86c1f7a1e2028aeacc3afef

commit_message:
Fix race condition on processing DVR floating IPs

Fip namespace and agent gateway port can be shared by multiple dvr routers.
This change uses a set as the control variable for these shared resources
and ensures that Test and Set operation on the control variable are
performed atomically so that race conditions do not occur among
multiple threads processing floating IPs.
Limitation: The scope of this change is limited to addressing the race
condition described in the bug report. It may not address other issues
such as pre-existing issue with handling of DVR floatingips on agent
restart.

closes-bug: #1381238

cherry-picked from 9902400039018d77aa3034147cfb24ca4b2353f6
Change-Id: I6dc2b7bad6e8ddbaa86c1f7a1e2028aeacc3afef

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-25 08:39:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_ha_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_schedulers.py'], 'message': 'Moves the HA resource creations outside of transaction

Currently the HA resources are created in the
_create_router_db which includes calls to
the plugin and generates RPC calls. Even if the
resource creations are outside of any transaction
from the _create_router_db point of view, this
method is  called in a transaction from the
create_router method.
This patch moves the resource creations to the
create_router method outside the transaction.
The failures are handled as previously with
a try/expect.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_ha_db.py

Change-Id: If8fcfd012f8e992175e49bbefb2ae667881a620a
Closes-bug: #1374461
(cherry picked from commit ccd650732729451aa8e5ce3401f9570c70c4f066)
'}]
commit_message:
Moves the HA resource creations outside of transaction

Currently the HA resources are created in the
_create_router_db which includes calls to
the plugin and generates RPC calls. Even if the
resource creations are outside of any transaction
from the _create_router_db point of view, this
method is  called in a transaction from the
create_router method.
This patch moves the resource creations to the
create_router method outside the transaction.
The failures are handled as previously with
a try/expect.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_ha_db.py

Change-Id: If8fcfd012f8e992175e49bbefb2ae667881a620a
Closes-bug: #1374461
(cherry picked from commit ccd650732729451aa8e5ce3401f9570c70c4f066)

There are a small number of examples of "eager" interpolation in
neutron:
  logging.debug("foo %s" % arg)

These should be converted to perform the interpolation lazily within
the logging function, since if the severity is below the logging level
then the interpolation can be skipped entirely.

This change addresses all such current examples found in neutron core
via a pylint test.  Vendor plugins and services are fixed elsewhere.

Change-Id: I823d8453cd76e4985cabd31ca6b939f43a80b36c
Partial-Bug: #1404788

commit_message:
Use lazy logging interpolation

There are a small number of examples of "eager" interpolation in
neutron:
  logging.debug("foo %s" % arg)

These should be converted to perform the interpolation lazily within
the logging function, since if the severity is below the logging level
then the interpolation can be skipped entirely.

This change addresses all such current examples found in neutron core
via a pylint test.  Vendor plugins and services are fixed elsewhere.

Change-Id: I823d8453cd76e4985cabd31ca6b939f43a80b36c
Partial-Bug: #1404788

commit_message:
NetApp E-series: Do not log passwords in requests

Previously, requests to the backend that contained passwords were
not scrubbed prior to logging.

Closes-bug: 1383444

Change-Id: I389d5115e4a6ffbae6f0463a62015f6ac01ec2e9
(cherry picked from commit: fdaf96621c011e1d0ee2666f8f547d47057f72d0)

for sets, dict comprehensions and set comprehensions.

commit_message:
Make the mutable default arg check very strict

Previously we were only checking for mutable literals. This adds checks
for any callable, which would include dict(), list(), etc.

Change-Id: I12e09f53cd00139549354906f3f4c08f689ff3e2

subject: Always use sudo -H when pip installing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-26 09:42:09.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/prepare_tripleo.sh', 'jenkins/jobs/sqlalchemy-migrate.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'nodepool/elements/README.rst', 'nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/install.d/99-install-zuul', 'nodepool/scripts/prepare_node.sh', 'nodepool/scripts/fix_pip.sh'], 'message': 'Always use sudo -H when pip installing

Recent versions of pip will create ~/.cache if it doesn't already exist.

If this happens while running "sudo pip" the resulting dir will be owned
by root and 700 - which breaks anything else on the system that wants to
use ~/.cache

I *think* this finds all instances of "sudo pip" in this repo and fixes
them to use -H. This should mean they always run in the right ~

Change-Id: I47ddb3b591df6ac2100f09b38c9b8a03cb1ba1ff
closes-bug: #1405732
'}]
commit_message:
Always use sudo -H when pip installing

Recent versions of pip will create ~/.cache if it doesn't already exist.

If this happens while running "sudo pip" the resulting dir will be owned
by root and 700 - which breaks anything else on the system that wants to
use ~/.cache

I *think* this finds all instances of "sudo pip" in this repo and fixes
them to use -H. This should mean they always run in the right ~

Change-Id: I47ddb3b591df6ac2100f09b38c9b8a03cb1ba1ff
closes-bug: #1405732

To support both Python 2 and Python 3, "six.moves.map"

commit_message:
Use six.moves.map instead of itertools.imap

In Python 3, module "itertools" doesn't contain "imap" object.
To support both Python 2 and Python 3, "six.moves.map"
should be used instead.

Change-Id: I5b82020d0721a91aa6d6090a42073a3285b80ff9
Closes-Bug: #1403434

commit_message:
Change payload in notification to contain uuid

The payload is changed to contain table_uuid
along with table_name. Cases where uuid is
not available, the field would be an empty string.
A new field called index.count is also added when
magnetodb.table.create.end is genarated. This is
generated to keep a count of indices in Ceilometer.
Also updated the log messages to contain uuid.

Changed the user field in context to contain
user_id instead of user_name.

Closes-bug: #1400695

Change-Id: Ia6bfbf929945f922382dd7d6a0965863edd5b8b7

subject: test compatibility for old imports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-02 17:29:08.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_import.py'], 'message': 'test compatibility for old imports

The following test is for compatibility for the namespace move. Having
this test in the oslo.concurrency tree will ensure that not only do
the imports functionally work, but that hacking can pass on this test,
which ensures that hacking is compatible after the namespace change.

The previous patches to oslo.concurrency extensively used # noqa,
which masked out the issue for oslo.concurrency, thus allowing the
release to break other parts of OpenStack.

Change-Id: Icd118a00a8ec0d9fb0bd9d60826676eec2a08f47
Related-Bug: #1398472
'}]
commit_message:
test compatibility for old imports

The following test is for compatibility for the namespace move. Having
this test in the oslo.concurrency tree will ensure that not only do
the imports functionally work, but that hacking can pass on this test,
which ensures that hacking is compatible after the namespace change.

The previous patches to oslo.concurrency extensively used # noqa,
which masked out the issue for oslo.concurrency, thus allowing the
release to break other parts of OpenStack.

Change-Id: Icd118a00a8ec0d9fb0bd9d60826676eec2a08f47
Related-Bug: #1398472

commit_message:
Support for plugable actions in nailgun

- Serialize tasks for specific role in deployment serializer
- Plugable tasks should be stored on filesystem and will be fetched
  be next glob

  /etc/puppet/{RELEASE_VERSION}/roles/*.yaml

  Default path can be configured in settings.yaml - TASK_DIR variable

Implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I635001951cf11445485fab2833043c396dfb85b1

Current orchestration capabilities requires to serialize
priorities for tasks in a very strict manner.

We are not able to run anything except puppet in parallel,

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks
Change-Id: Icf0c3bf73c40b6f465621187328128b4b6d7e67a
'}]
commit_message:
Use global scope for orchestrator tasks in main stage

Current orchestration capabilities requires to serialize
priorities for tasks in a very strict manner.

We are not able to run anything except puppet in parallel,
with exception that we are running same task

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks
Change-Id: Icf0c3bf73c40b6f465621187328128b4b6d7e67a

subject: Use dict comprehensions instead of dict constructor
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-25 01:45:15.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/ipmi/notifications/test_ironic.py'], 'message': "Use dict comprehensions instead of dict constructor

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions [1], these are benefits:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/

Change-Id: Ie0d2e79ad30894a9eec6c7999c56e1c641bb0f4c
"}]
commit_message:
Use dict comprehensions instead of dict constructor

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions [1], these are benefits:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/

Change-Id: Ie0d2e79ad30894a9eec6c7999c56e1c641bb0f4c

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-24 13:44:07.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_node_nic_assignment.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_network_validation.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_put_same_json.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_network_configuration.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/network_configuration.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_cluster_changes_handler.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_task.py'], 'message': 'Return error HTTP code for incorrect neutron conf

Recently, we used to return error message for incorrect neutron config
without error HTTP status code. In other words, the "202 Accepted" was
always returned regardless it was successful or not.

Since now, tbe "400 Bad Request" will be returned in case of error and
"200 OK" in case of success (there's no reason to return "202 Accepted"
for synchronous task).

Change-Id: I9ad16fceb930332b427773dec32bd84d30fb1fd3
Closes-Bug: #1404821
'}]
commit_message:
Return error HTTP code for incorrect neutron conf

Recently, we used to return error message for incorrect neutron config
without error HTTP status code. In other words, the "202 Accepted" was
always returned regardless it was successful or not.

Since now, tbe "400 Bad Request" will be returned in case of error and
"200 OK" in case of success (there's no reason to return "202 Accepted"
for synchronous task).

Change-Id: I9ad16fceb930332b427773dec32bd84d30fb1fd3
Closes-Bug: #1404821

commit_message:
Sync the latest loopingcall module from oslo-incubator

We have not done a sync of loopingcall since its dependency
upon the old i18n module was removed.  To get that old code
removed we need to do this sync.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
---------------------
commit 36b0e8570b449129d6d474c03b02ceb62edb78df
Date:   Thu Dec 11 11:27:08 2014 +0100
We shouldn't replace `oslo-incubator` in comments

Change being merged with this patch:
---------------------
5d40e143 -  Remove code that moved to oslo.i18n

Change-Id: I2fd9cb73cf347adfb2ce203e45d5059604ed5f7a

commit_message:
Add apiclient to openstack-common.conf and sync to latest

No matter what we do with apiclient in future, I think we should
include it in openstack-common.conf file since we're using it.

This patch also syncs with latest oslo-incubator, to solve bug
1354470 and safe log auth token when --debug is enabled, see
https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/apiclient/client.py#L128

Change-Id: I5334d4dfd8676656f188ba50b93a22c700340239
Closes-Bug: #1354470

commit_message:
Add oslo.concurrency module to tox --env genconfig

We have used oslo.concurrency module, which has defined two configuration
options 'disable_process_locking' and 'lock_path', this patch adds those
two options to generated ceilometer.conf

see: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.concurrency/blob/master/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py#L40

commit_message:
Use from six.moves.urllib.parse instead of urlparse

In Python 3, urlparse module is gone.
To support both Python 2 and Python 3, "six.moves.urllib.parse"
should be used instead.

Change-Id: I0adddbdea5a80606907a1b78ca1a04d15f61452b
Closes-Bug: #1403433

subject: Keep __hash__ consistent with __eq__
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-03 16:04:19.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/transport.py', 'tests/test_target.py', 'oslo/messaging/target.py'], 'message': 'Keep __hash__ consistent with __eq__

oslo.messaging.target.Target has implemented __hash__ and __eq__,
but they are not consistent. Even two Target objects are equal,
their hash values are not same, which leads to cannot use Target
object as dict key and in set.

This patch fixes it by using vars(self).items() as hash value.

Change-Id: I0ce47744bdafe708a1d16bb20e33c42ddc4f10a9
Closes-Bug: #1398511
'}]
commit_message:
Keep __hash__ consistent with __eq__

oslo.messaging.target.Target has implemented __hash__ and __eq__,
but they are not consistent. Even two Target objects are equal,
their hash values are not same, which leads to cannot use Target
object as dict key and in set.

This patch fixes it by using vars(self).items() as hash value.

Change-Id: I0ce47744bdafe708a1d16bb20e33c42ddc4f10a9
Closes-Bug: #1398511

subject: Add possibility to suppress errors in Tempest plugin cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-23 17:49:42.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/tempest/tempest/api/share/base.py', 'contrib/ci/post_test_hook.sh', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/config_share.py'], 'message': "Add possibility to suppress errors in Tempest plugin cleanup

Now if something can not be cleaned up we get error and in case of CI job it is
'fail' of job. We should be able to suppress such errors.
Added config option 'suppress_errors_in_cleanup' that allows us to raise errors
when it is 'False' and log errors when it is 'True'.
Disable it by default.
Enable it for CI Tempest jobs.

Implements blueprint tempest-clean-up-suppress-errors

Change-Id: I03a39cc020f52d54211369c8f5cbfc2e14651a21
"}]
commit_message:
Add possibility to suppress errors in Tempest plugin cleanup

Now if something can not be cleaned up we get error and in case of CI job it is
'fail' of job. We should be able to suppress such errors.
Added config option 'suppress_errors_in_cleanup' that allows us to raise errors
when it is 'False' and log errors when it is 'True'.
Disable it by default.
Enable it for CI Tempest jobs.

Implements blueprint tempest-clean-up-suppress-errors

Change-Id: I03a39cc020f52d54211369c8f5cbfc2e14651a21

subject: Enable usage of container outside of Kubernetes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-28 00:50:22.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/start.sh'], 'message': "Enable usage of container outside of Kubernetes

Kubernetes currently creates blah_SERVICE_HOST env vars as part
of starting the containers. However this is not done when starting
them with plain docker.

Rather than updating the script to use the regular env vars just
default blah_SERVICE_HOST to the common version if its not already
set.

This change enables the usage of --link in plain 'docker run' to wire
together this keystone container with its dependent mariadb one.

Change-Id: Ia3bc946b059c44af7682603c45150f6956ccfb6d
"}]
commit_message:
Enable usage of container outside of Kubernetes

Kubernetes currently creates blah_SERVICE_HOST env vars as part
of starting the containers. However this is not done when starting
them with plain docker.

Rather than updating the script to use the regular env vars just
default blah_SERVICE_HOST to the common version if its not already
set.

This change enables the usage of --link in plain 'docker run' to wire
together this keystone container with its dependent mariadb one.

Change-Id: Ia3bc946b059c44af7682603c45150f6956ccfb6d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-19 07:34:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_volume.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Fix disconnecting necessary iSCSI sessions issue

In Icehouse with "iscsi_use_multipath=true", detaching a multipath
iSCSI volume kills all iSCSI volumes visible from the nova compute node.

When we use different targets(IQNs) associated with same portal for
each different multipath device, all of the targets will be deleted
via disconnect_volume().

This patch fixes the behavior of detaching volume:

  1. Extract the targets for the detached multipath device.
  2. Delete/disconnect the targets for the detached multipath device.

Closes-Bug: #1382440
(cherry picked from commit 36aeedfd5eeb0345d66fa8456ed6a9447a6514a0)

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_volume.py

Change-Id: I7b6ad02b8728fbed16716b3d312a5ffbd3c566b8
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fix disconnecting necessary iSCSI sessions issue

In Icehouse with "iscsi_use_multipath=true", detaching a multipath
iSCSI volume kills all iSCSI volumes visible from the nova compute node.

When we use different targets(IQNs) associated with same portal for
each different multipath device, all of the targets will be deleted
via disconnect_volume().

This patch fixes the behavior of detaching volume:

  1. Extract the targets for the detached multipath device.
  2. Delete/disconnect the targets for the detached multipath device.

Closes-Bug: #1382440
(cherry picked from commit 36aeedfd5eeb0345d66fa8456ed6a9447a6514a0)

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_volume.py

Change-Id: I7b6ad02b8728fbed16716b3d312a5ffbd3c566b8
